items.title: 'Selectie Nigeria dreigt met boycot richting kwartfinale Afrika Cup'
items.summary: Nigeria kent een onrustige aanloop naar de kwartfinale op de Afrika Cup van komende zaterdag tegen Algerije. De selectie dreigt de training te boycotten en mogelijk zelgs niet naar Marrakech af te reizen, als ze de beloofde premies niet ontvangen.

items.title: Juventus deliver tale of humiliation and redemption inside three days | Nicky Bandini
items.summary: On Saturday, Jonathan David‚Äôs lazy penalty cost Juventus a win. By Tuesday, he was the best player on the pitch Four years have passed since Andrea Agnelli, still the chairman of the European Club Association and president of Juventus back then, floated the idea of selling 15-minute viewing subscriptions for football games. A response to research showing that younger generations ‚Äì ‚Äútomorrow‚Äôs spenders‚Äù ‚Äì had shorter attention spans. Agnelli‚Äôs judgement has been called into question a few times since, between the failed launch of a European Super League and his suspension from Italian football following an investigation into financial irregularities at Juventus. But perhaps he was right about the need to serve modern audiences a faster fix of sporting theatre. Continue reading...

items.title: Transfers Feyenoord: ook Timber op de radar van Lazio
items.summary: Ook buiten de transferperiode om volgt VI het transfernieuws bij Feyenoord op de voet, ook omdat het sneller dan je denkt alweer januari is. De doelwitten van de Rotterdammers, duiding van de clubwatcher, of aandacht in buitenlandse media. We verzamelen alles hier.

items.title: What is Man Utd's 'DNA' and does it really matter?
items.summary: As Manchester United look for Ruben Amorim's successor, Phil McNulty asks if a club's so-called "DNA" is actually relevant?

items.title: Mourinho on shock loss: I hope players don't sleep
items.summary: An angry Benfica coach Jose Mourinho hopes his players had a sleepless night after their shock defeat to Braga in the Portuguese Allianz Cup semifinal on Wednesday.

items.title: Spurs captain Romero in fiery 'lies' post after loss
items.summary: Tottenham captain Cristian Romero appeared to accuse the club's hierarchy of "lies" in a fiery, now-edited social media post following the defeat to Bournemouth.

items.title: Rosenior unready to coach Chelsea loss at Fulham
items.summary: Liam Rosenior chose not to take charge of Chelsea for the first time in Wednesday's Premier League clash against Fulham because of the "difficult time-frame" between his appointment on Tuesday and the game at Craven Cottage.

items.title: Sesko: 'Great things' coming with United change
items.summary: Benjamin Sesko believes "great things are coming" despite managerless Manchester United's winless start to 2026.

items.title: Mourinho makes Benfica players sleep at training ground
items.summary: Jose Mourinho takes his players to stay at Benfica's training ground after they lose against Braga in the League Cup semi-final.

items.title: 'Real laat oog vallen op spelers Crystal Palace en Borussia Dortmund'
items.summary: In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in het buitenland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in Nederland.

items.title: Toekomst van Oranje: Gjivai Zechi√´l
items.summary: De Toekomst van Oranje is terug. Voetbal International sprak in deze serie in het verleden met toptalenten zoals Cody Gakpo, Brian Brobbey en de gebroeders Timber. Nu is het de beurt aan Isaac Babadi, Gjivai Zechi√´l, Ezechiel Banzuzi en Ernest Poku. We bespreken hun kwaliteiten, valkuilen en dromen! In deze aflevering alle aandacht voor Gjivai Zechi√´l, de 21-middenvelder van Feyenoord die dit seizoen op huurbasis speelt voor FC Utrecht.

items.title: Verwarring in Eindhoven door spandoek: 'PVS wenst je een sportief 2026'
items.summary: Een spandoek in Eindhoven heeft voor de nodige opschudding gezorgd. PSV gaf bij het Philips Stadion een mooie boodschap aan de fans, maar een spelfout werd gezien als hint voor een contractverlenging.

items.title: Ex-Premier League ref David Coote gets suspended sentence over schoolboy video
items.summary: Coote, 43, had previously pleaded guilty to making an indecent moving image of a child The former Premier League referee David Coote has been given a suspended sentence after he was found to have a sexual video of a 15-year-old boy in school uniform on his laptop. Judge Shant said Coote, 43, had a ‚Äúspectacular fall from grace‚Äù after police charged him with making a category A video, the most serious kind, of a 15-year-old schoolboy. The charge refers to activities such as downloading, sharing or saving photos or videos containing abuse. Continue reading...

items.title: Ex-Premier League referee Coote given suspended sentence over child image offence
items.summary: Former football official David Coote is given a nine-month prison sentence, suspended for two years.

items.title: Exeter City‚Äôs plea for more FA Cup cash from Manchester City turned down
items.summary: League One club asked for greater share of gate receipts Manchester City not changing their standard club policy Manchester City will not offer Exeter extra money from Saturday‚Äôs third-round FA Cup tie. The financially troubled League One club this week revealed they had asked the Premier League club for a greater proportion of the gate receipts as a ‚Äústatement of solidarity‚Äù. Exeter, whose supporters‚Äô trust is the club‚Äôs majority shareholder, will take 8,000 fans to a sold-out Etihad Stadium to face the seven-time FA Cup winners. Each club gets 45% of gate receipts, with the other 10% taken by the Football Association, in line with competition rules. It is estimated ticket sales will generate between ¬£250,000 and ¬£400,000 for Exeter. Continue reading...

items.title: Coote gets suspended prison sentence over child image offence
items.summary: David Coote has been sentenced to nine months in prison, suspended for two years, after pleading guilty to making an indecent image of a child.

items.title: Chiefs aware of domestic violence allegations directed towards Rice
items.summary: The Kansas City Chiefs said in a statement on Wednesday they were aware of domestic violence allegations made in a series of social media posts by a former girlfriend of wide receiver Rashee Rice and had been in communication with the NFL.

items.title: Captain Romero appears to call out Spurs chiefs in edited social media post
items.summary: Tottenham captain Cristian Romero appears to take aim at the club's hierarchy, accusing them of telling "lies" in a since edited Instagram post.

items.title: ‚ÄòThe club is in a mess‚Äô: Manchester United fans voice feelings before the next interim twist
items.summary: Supporters serenaded Solskj√¶r, Carrick and Fletcher among others at Burnley and staged a brief anti-Ratcliffe protest ‚ÄúJim can‚Äôt fix this,‚Äù the sign said. Bright red letters nestled on a white background, a stark contrast in an away end at Turf Moor full of dark-coated figures in front of which they were held aloft. It was small, a couple of square metres of material, maybe. But the message to Sir Jim Ratcliffe was powerful. Remember your lane, Jim? Yeah, stick in it, pal. As Darren Fletcher, in Manchester United blazer and red tie, strolled along the touchline, flanked by tracksuited his former teammate and friend Jonny Evans, the flag flew. And then it was gone. The protest was done. Continue reading...

items.title: Can Coventry recover from recent blip to maintain promotion charge?
items.summary: Six points clear at the top of the Championship as we swing into January was more than any Coventry City fan would have expected when the seaason started back in August.
